quotes.quote: Never insult a mans beard, you either get thunder or lightning.

A man with a beard was always a little suspect anyway. You couldn't say you wore a beard because you liked a beard. People didn't like you for telling the truth. You had to say you had a scar so you couldn't shave.
Ideas are like beards; men do not have them until they grow up.
Surrender one hair, and you'll end up beardless.
Having a beard is a good way to make your face more susceptible to velcro.
Having a beard is natural. When you think about it, shaving it off is quite weird.
A decent beard has long been the number one must-have fashion item for any fugitive from justice.
It is almost impossible to carry the torch of truth through a crowd without singeing somebody's beard.
Kissing a man with a beard is a lot like going to a picnic. You don't mind going through a little bush to get there!
A beard on a man is only a way of hiding something, his face of course, but also the inner matters, like a hedge around a secret garden, or a cover over a bird cage.
A man's face is not a rich person's lawn … Nor is a man's face the woods.
A goatee is to beards what diamonds are to ornaments.
There is always a period when a man with a beard shaves it off. This period does not last. He returns headlong to his beard.
Some of these guys wear beards to make them look intimidating, but they don't look so tough when they have to deliver the ball. Their abilities and their attitudes don't back up their beards.
The beard must not be plucked. Ye shall not deface the figure of your beard.
You can wear your hair long or wear a beard because you want to show that you are interested in thought, in psychological endeavors rather than appearance.
Growing a beard is a habit most natural, Scriptural, manly and beneficial.
You can't do comedy with a beard.
A beardless cynic is the shame of nature.
You cannot grow a beard in a moment of passion.
A beard well lathered is half shaven.
A man without beard is like lion without mane.
